summary: Email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutors and French individuals regarding scheduling a call for the ongoing SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. The prosecutors are seeking to speak with Nicolas Cassart and Nicolas Boulay.

persons.name: Nicolas Cassart
persons.context: French individual whom SDNY prosecutors are attempting to schedule a call with regarding the Epstein/Maxwell investigation. He suggests a meeting time and requests a Teams invitation.

persons.name: Nicolas Boulay
persons.context: Copied on the email exchange, identified as the partner of Nicolas Cassart, and also noted as being available for the proposed call with SDNY prosecutors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the ongoing federal investigation being conducted by the SDNY.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the subject of the ongoing prosecution being handled by the SDNY prosecutors.

connections.description: Referred to as partners in the context of being contacted by the SDNY.
Both are central subjects of the SDNY's ongoing investigation and prosecution, as stated by the prosecutors.

events.title: SDNY Investigation Contact
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutors from the Southern District of New York reach out to French individuals Nicolas Cassart and Nicolas Boulay to schedule a call regarding the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell was ongoing as of March 2021.
SDNY prosecutors were actively seeking to interview French nationals Nicolas Cassart and Nicolas Boulay.
The communication shows international investigative reach by the SDNY in the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The document is an email chain focused on scheduling a call, indicating procedural steps in the investigation.
